MS MCQs

    Manage and organize your product catalog with Dynamics 365 Sales

    »

    1. Which of the following statements best describes unit groups in Microsoft Dynamics 365?

      Unit groups specify the quantities or measurements that products can be sold in.

      Unit groups specify how products are grouped for discounting.

      Unit groups specify grouping data so that products can be related to each other.

      Unit groups specify price details for products and services.


    2. You want to let your sales representatives enter product properties, like size and color, and other items when they add an item to a record. Where do product properties have to be defined with setting up the product catalog?

      Individual product

      Product family

      Product bundle

      Price list


    3. Which of the following components of the product catalog aren’t required?

      Unit groups

      Discount lists

      Products

      Price lists


    4. Your organization uses product families, and it just added several new products to its product catalog. What has to be done to the products before they can be added to opportunities in Dynamics 365?

      The product must be enabled for sales records.

      The product must be approved.

      The product must be published.

      Nothing. The product is ready to use.
